text: ارءيت من اتخذ الهه هوىه افانت تكون عليه وكيلا

translations.translation: Have you seen him who has taken his whims and desires to be his god? Will you then be his guardian?
Have you considered him who takes his own lust for his god? Can you stand a surety for him?
Have you ever considered the case of the person who has made his lust his god? Can you take the responsibility of guiding such a one aright?
How can you be the guardian of those who have chosen their own desires as their Lord?
Did you see the one who chose his own desires as his God? So will you accept the responsibility of guarding him?
Have you seen him who has taken as his god his own vain desire Would you then be a guardian over him
Have you seen him who takes his low desires for his god? Will you then be a protector over him?
Hast thou seen him who has taken his caprice to be his god? Wilt thou be a guardian over them?
Hast thou seen him who chooseth for his god his own lust? Wouldst thou then be guardian over him?
Have you seen him who has taken his own desire to be his god? Can you be a guardian over him?
Hast thou observed him who hath taken as his god his own desire! wilt thou be over him a trustee?
Have you seen him who has taken his desire to be his god? Is it your duty to watch over him?
Seest thou such a one as taketh for his god his own passion (or impulse)? Couldst thou be a disposer of affairs for him?
Have you (O Muhammad SAW) seen him who has taken as his ilah (god) his own desire? Would you then be a Wakil (a disposer of his affairs or a watcher) over him?
Have you seen him who has made gods of his own desires? Would you be a guardian over him?
Have you seen him who chose his desire as his god? Would you be an agent for him?
Have you seen the one who takes as his god his own desire? Then would you be responsible for him?

[25:43] Have you seen — inform Me [about] — him who has taken as his god his own desire?, that is, as something that will be bring about his ruin (the indirect object [ilāhahu, ‘as his god’] precedes the direct object because it is more important; the clause [beginning] man ittakhadha, ‘him who has taken’, constitutes the first direct object of a-ra’ayta, ‘have you seen’, the second being [the following, a-fa-anta …]) Will you be a guardian over him?, a protector to preserve him from following his desires? No.

(Hast thou) Muhammad (seen him who chooseth for his god his own lust) who worshipped his god, i.e. al- Nadr and his host, out of the whim of his ego? (Wouldst thou) Muhammad (then be guardian over him) a protector against going out for such corruption? But this was abrogated by the verse of jihad; it is also said that this means: would you be their protector from chastisement?

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text:
ثمَّ قال سبحانه على التوبيخ لعامة المشركين المتخذين غير الله إلهاً
 سواء كانوا مشركين بالشرك الجلي أو الخفي
 المسندين الأفعال والحوادث الكائنة في عالم الكون والفساد إلى الأسباب والوسائل العادية على مقتضى هوية نفوسهم
 وذلك لجهلهم بالله وغفلتهم عن إحاطة علمه وقدرته
 وجميع أوصافه وأسمائه بجميع ما ظهر وبطن
 وكان ويكون: { أَرَأَيْتَ } أي: أخبرني يا أكمل الرسل إن كنت من أهل الخبرة والذكاء
 أتهدي وترشد إلى التوحيد { مَنِ ٱتَّخَذَ إِلَـٰهَهُ هَوَاهُ } أي: من اتخذ هواه ومشتهى قلبه إلهاً يعبده كعبادة الله
 قدَّم المفعول الثاني
 للغاية والاهتمام { أَفَأَنتَ } يا أكمل الرسل { تَكُونُ عَلَيْهِ وَكِيلاً } [الفرقان: 43] حفيظاً تحفظه عن متابعة هواه ومقتضى طبعه
 مع أنا جبلناه وأثبتناه في لوح قضائنا وحضرة علمنا أنه من الأشقياء المردودين؟!

commentaries.author: ابن عجيبة
commentaries.text:
{ أفأنت تكون عليه وكيلاً } حفيظاً تحفظه عن متابعة هواه وعبادة ما يهواه
 والفاء لترتيب الإنكار على ما قبله، كأنه قيل: أَبَعْدَمَا شاهدت من غلوه في طاعة الهوى، وعتوه عن اتباع الهدى، تقهره على الإيمان، شاء أو أبى، وإنما عليك التبليغ فقط
